column4: I'm on ubuntu 10.4 LTS trying reinstall coucdb and the init.d script is gone...
err couchdb
your question?
can i reinstall and have apt regenerate the init.d?
easiest way is to purge the package, then reinstall
i tired that...
i'll try again though...
why is the file gone anyway?
i accidentally deleted it when trying to upgrade from backports...
k, anyway purging and installing will restore the file
stupid i know... i should have just backed it up
i did apitude remove package --purge
erm, I don't think that's valid syntax for aptitude
purge first?
the syntax is « aptitude purge PACKAGE »
thx trying that now
after i purge couch is still running...
do i need to reboot the box?
probably because there's no init script...
ok rebooting...
gah rebooted and now i cant ssh
-generic on the desktop -server on the server
